definition: to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)
to file a lawsuit/to sue/to dispute
to face legal action/to get sued

sentences.english: In any event, protecting yourself against such a case is relatively easy.
sentences.chinese: 無論如何，防止自己攤上這種官司相對比較容易。

sentences.english: So the officials don't want you to finish.
sentences.chinese: 所以那些官員不希望官司結束。

sentences.english: The most feared punishment is the defamation lawsuit which can result in permanent financial ruin.
sentences.chinese: 最令人懼怕的是會造成永久破財的毀謗官司。

sentences.english: Eisenbrey is closely watching the Black Swan case.
sentences.chinese: 艾森佈雷正在密切關注這場因《黑天鵝》而起的官司。

sentences.english: Mr. Katsav denied the allegations and took a leave of absence to fight the charges.
sentences.chinese: 卡察夫否認這些指控，並暫時離職以應付這場官司。

sentences.english: Such a policy keeps them out of court and out of trouble.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的政策使它們免予官司麻煩。

sentences.english: Lawyer Leanna Sweet gives everything to win the case.
sentences.chinese: 打贏官司的律師李安娜甜給的一切。

sentences.english: He did five years for robbery.
sentences.chinese: 他因搶劫而吃了五年官司。

sentences.english: Henry took it to avoid the crushing legal expense of a long trial.
sentences.chinese: 爲了避免長期打官司的鉅額訴訟費，亨利接受了。

sentences.english: Hao 9 and peach kyi reconciliation, peach kyi win the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 浩九和桃姬和好如初，桃姬打贏了官司。

sentences.english: Though you have lost the lawsuit, I would still pay the full price you charged.
sentences.chinese: 雖然官司輸了，但是你的律師費要照付。

sentences.english: When encountered in the lawsuit , peasant often show non-litigation complex.
sentences.chinese: 當農民遇到官司時往往會表現出非訴訟情結。

sentences.english: He was a barrister of Philadelphia, but became far more renowned by his gun than by his law cases.
sentences.chinese: 他是費城的律師，但他打官司遠不及打槍出名。

sentences.english: Your blog entangles you with the tentacles of the law.
sentences.chinese: 你的部落格讓你身陷麻煩的官司。

sentences.english: And if they find it, we got a lawsuit .
sentences.chinese: 要是他們發現了，我們要喫官司的。

sentences.english: The judicial procedures in Qing was that the related departments tried cases in accordance with certain forms and formulas.
sentences.chinese: 清代的司法程序是承審官司遵照一定程式去審理案件。

definition: to file a lawsuit/to sue/to dispute
public courtroom accusation (idiom)/legal confrontation/to take sb to court/to sue
to face legal action/to get sued
to sue/to take to court/to file a lawsuit
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
to ask for compensation/to claim damages/claim for damages
